questions.description: Low: No injury, minor quality issue. Medium: Reversible illness, short-term impact. High: Serious illness or hospitalization.
questions.tooltip: Severity describes how serious the impact would be if this hazard occurred, ranging from minor quality issues to serious illness.

questions.description: Low: Unlikely to occur. Medium: Occasional. High: Likely or frequent.
questions.tooltip: Likelihood describes how often this hazard could realistically occur under your actual process conditions.
A significant hazard is one that is likely to occur and likely to cause illness or injury if not controlled. This decision triggers the CCP determination process.
PRP (Prerequisite Program) = General hygiene rules (e.g. cleaning, training). Process Control = Specific checks at this step (e.g. temperature check).
Briefly describe how this hazard is controlled. Examples: 'Daily temperature checks', 'Supplier approval procedure', 'Metal detection'.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Temperature monitoring every 4 hours, Visual inspection of incoming goods
